title: (Help Please) Boot Kaspersky and F-Secure from UBCD on USB

forumNotes.author: markhelp
forumNotes.content:
Hello, I am customizing my UBCD and would like to be able to boot Kaspersky Rescue CD and F-Secure Rescue CD. Here is what I have for my .cfg file: Kaspersky: (basically I extracted the ISO and the .cfg file that the cd uses and updated the language and changed the file paths) ``` label - menu label Kaspersky     linux /ubcd/custom/kaspersky/boot/rescue root=/dev/ram0 vga=791 init=/linuxrc looptype=squashfs loop=/ubcd/custom/kaspersky/image.squashfs nodevfs cdroot initrd=/ubcd/custom/kaspersky/rescue.igz kav_lang=en udev aufs quiet noresume doscsi     initrd /ubcd/custom/kaspersky/boot/rescue.igz ```
Whenever I try to boot Kaspersky from my ISO it works for a while then says: !!Media not found \>\>No bootable medium found. Waiting for new devices... F-Secure ``` label - menu label F-Secure kernel /ubcd/custom/fsecure/linux     APPEND ramdisk_size=100000 lang=en vt.default_utf8=0 vga=normal atapicd nosound noapic nolapic noacpi pnpbios=off acpi=off noscsi nodma noapm nopcmcia nofirewire noagp nomce nodhcp initrd=/ubcd/custom/fsecure/minirt.gz loglevel=10 ```
F-Secure boots fine for a while and then says: Could not mount disk to /mnt-system. Starting debugging Shell... sh: can't access tty; job control turned off
It seems that my issues for both disks are similar. If anyone can help me I would appreciate it.
Mark

forumNotes.author: mike05
forumNotes.content:
Hello Friend  
1- download XBOX  
2- drag and drop your Kav_Rescue10.iso and f-secure iso  
3- in green box scroll down and point to the kaspersky and f-secure to boot metthod  
3-create iso or usb  
4-boot from usb or,, if you want to boot from cd and grub then copy all the content extracted from kaspersky and put them in grub root dir .  
5- copy the line from syslink.cfg put the line in grub menu entry  
6- when you boot kaspersky on eula accepting screen it will seem like keyboard is stuck,,, but its not.. you just right click twice on screen then press "A" to accept eula txt ..........tested works 100%  

Good luck
